arabicText: أَءِذَا مِتْنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابًۭا وَعِظَـٰمًا أَءِنَّا لَمَدِينُونَ
englishTranslationText:
‘That	when	we	are	dead	and	have	turned	
into	dust	and	bones,	that	we	will	either	be	
rewarded	or	punished?’	”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kyā		jab	ham	mar	kar	mitti	aur	haddiyāñ	ho	
jāyeñ	ge	to	kyā		hameñ	jazā	sazā	di	jāye	gi.

englishTranslationText:
He	said	(to	others	on	the	thrones),	“Will	you	
take	a	glimpse	(into	hell)	below?”
romanUrduTranslationText: Kahā	kyā		tum	jhāñk	kar	dekho	ge.

englishTranslationText:
He	therefore	looked	down	and	saw	him	
amidst	the	blazing	fire.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	jhāñkā	to	usey	bich	bhadakti	āag	meiñ	
dekhā.

englishTranslationText: He	said,	“By	Allah,	you	had	nearly	ruined	me!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kahā	Khudā	ki	qasam	qarib	thā	ke	tu	
mujhe	halāk	kar	de.

arabicText: وَلَوْلَا نِعْمَةُ رَبِّى لَكُنتُ مِنَ ٱلْمُحْضَرِينَ
englishTranslationText:
“And	were	it	not	for	the	munificence	of	my	
Lord,	I	too	would	have	been	seized	and	
brought	forth	(captive)!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	merā	Rab	fazl	na	kare	to	zaroor	maiñ	
bhi	pakad	kar	ḥāzir	kiyā	jātā.

englishTranslationText:
“So	are	we	never	to	die?”	(The people of 
Paradise will ask the angels, with delight, 
after the announcement of everlasting 
life.)
